metadata.title: PrDOS: Prediction of disordered protein regions from amino acid sequence
metadata.abstract: PrDOS is a server that predicts the disordered regions of a protein from its amino acid sequence (http://prdos.hgc.jp). The server accepts a single protein amino acid sequence, in either plain text or FASTA format. The prediction system is composed of two predictors: a predictor based on local amino acid sequence information and one based on template proteins. The server combines the results of the two predictors and returns a two-state prediction (order/disorder) and a disorder probability for each residue. The prediction results are sent by e-mail, and the server also provides a web-interface to check the results. © 2007 The Author(s).

description: PrDOS (Protein Disorder Prediction Server) is a server to predict the disordered regions of a protein from its amino acid sequence.
name: PrDOS
